channel.title: Bluesky on Warp and Weft Data
channel.description: Recent content in Bluesky on Warp and Weft Data

item.title: Bluesky Data in R
item.description:
Just needed to add BLUESKY_APP_USER and BLUESKY_APP_PASS to .Renviron. If you are using a custom handle the user name is that. You get the password from the advanced area in settings in the bluesky app.

#install.packages('bskyr')
library(bskyr)

## Warning: package 'bskyr' was built under R version 4.4.2

library(tidyverse)

## ── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
## ✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
## ✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
## ✔ ggplot2   3.5.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
## ✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
## ✔ purrr     1.0.2     
## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
## ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
## ✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
## ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

following <- bs_get_follows('warpandweftdata.com', limit = 3000) |>
  mutate(created_at = as.Date(created_at))

## 
Fetching follows ■■■■■■■■ 23% | ETA: 7s

Fetching follows ■■■■■■■■■■ 30% | ETA:

head(following)

## # A tibble: 6 × 26
##   did             handle display_name avatar associated_chat_allo…¹ viewer_muted
##   <chr>           <chr>  <chr>        <chr>  <chr>                  <chr>       
## 1 did:plc:vjug55… emily… Emily        https… following              FALSE       
## 2 did:plc:pwwiti… priet… Paul Rietsc… https… <NA>                   FALSE       
## 3 did:plc:3kfxn6… erikg… Erik Gunn    https… all                    FALSE       
## 4 did:plc:esmiux… o.sim… Olivier Sim… https… following              FALSE       
## 5 did:plc:ei55r5… paulc… Paul Campbe… https… <NA>                   FALSE       
## 6 did:plc:zku4sm… krisa… Dr. Kristy … https… following              FALSE       
## # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​associated_chat_allow_incoming
## # ℹ 20 more variables: viewer_blocked_by <chr>, viewer_following <chr>,
## #   created_at <date>, description <chr>, indexed_at <chr>,
## #   viewer_followed_by <chr>, labels_src <chr>, labels_uri <chr>,
## #   labels_cid <chr>, labels_val <chr>, labels_cts <chr>, subject_did <chr>,
## #   subject_handle <chr>, subject_display_name <chr>, subject_avatar <chr>,
## #   subject_viewer_muted <chr>, subject_viewer_blocked_by <chr>, …

# Group by Year-Month and count the number of accounts
monthly_counts <- following %>%
  mutate(year_month = floor_date(created_at, "month")) %>%
  group_by(year_month) %>%
  summarise(accounts_created = n())

# Plotting with ggplot2
ggplot(monthly_counts, aes(x = year_month, y = accounts_created)) +
  geom_line(size = 1) +  # Line plot for continuity
  geom_point(size = 2) + # Points for emphasis on monthly counts
  labs(
    title = "When Did the People I Follow Get Here?",
    x = "Month",
    y = "Number of Accounts Created"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, face = "bold"),
    axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1)
  ) +
  scale_x_date(date_labels = "%b %Y", date_breaks = "1 month")

## Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0.
## ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead.
## This warning is displayed once every 8 hours.
## Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was
## generated.

bs_post(
  text = 'Test posting to bsky from R.'
)

## 2 at://did:plc:2hrlgtim52k5abklvizj7qbn/app.bsky… bafy… <chr>  valid
